meanings.definition: Cascables (noun): the hammer of a firearm
meanings.sent1: The soldier carefully examined the cascables of his rifle.
meanings.sent2: The gunsmith polished the cascables of the antique musket.
meanings.sent3: The cascables of the old shotgun looked like tiny hammers.
meanings.sent4: His words hit her heart like cascables striking steel.
meanings.sent5: The cascables of the pistol gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Cascables (adjective): relating to the hammer of a firearm
meanings.sent1: The cascables design on the rifle was intricate.
meanings.sent2: She admired the cascables details on the gun.
meanings.sent3: The cascables pattern on the shotgun was unique.
meanings.sent4: His cascables ideas struck a chord with the team.
meanings.sent5: The cascables engraving on the revolver was beautiful.
